title_review: Alone or with friends, this place remains top notch for tapas and meals!
review_preview: It had been a few years, but I remembered the solomillo al whiskey as being especially good, and after some tasty navajas a la plancha at Bar Cruz on c/Maldonados, we wanted something more substantial. So we walked over to Juana la Loca. WOW is...
review_full: It had been a few years, but I remembered the solomillo al whiskey as being especially good, and after some tasty navajas a la plancha at Bar Cruz on c/Maldonados, we wanted something more substantial. So we walked over to Juana la Loca. WOW is the food there ever holding up! The chefs work in the "new" tapas style (not so new anymore, but still scrumptious), influenced by Spain's culinary revolution of the late 90s. We shared a generous ración of squid ink fideos with a wonderful onion-calamari marmelade (out of this world), a plate of cantabrian anchovies that were enormous, and dense and rich (again, fabulous), and a bottle of 2008 Emilio Moro Ribera del Duero that kept the conversation running late into the night. As always, the service was friendly and helpful. A new touch I liked: one or two people in there, eating on their own. That's still sort of hard to find in this town. So add Juana la Loca to the list of places that work for one (if you're hungry: the place is primarily raciones, not small tapas). Important note: Juana la Loca is CASH ONLY! The atms nearby seem safe to use, despite the rowdy, usually very drunken, juerga that gets going in the plaza in the evenings. Do practice the usual cautions against pickpockets. Metro La Latina close by.

There is a good selection of wine by the glass which is clearly displayed on a chalkboard behind the counter.  As well as the tortilla we had the egg on the truffle that others have talked about, excellent also. The price was slightly more than that for similar food elsewhere however quality, freshness and presentation made it worth it! It is suitable for a snack or a full meal.

review_preview: As a complete surprise I was taken to Club Allard as a birthday treat. What a treat it was ! We were the second to arrive at 2100.  The atmosphere built as more patrons arrived.,The four of us elected to have the "middle" menu..the seduction...
review_full: As a complete surprise I was taken to Club Allard as a birthday treat. What a treat it was !  We were the second to arrive at 2100. The atmosphere built as more patrons arrived.,The four of us elected to have the "middle" menu..the seduction menu.  I won't describe in detail the various tasting plates: starting plates: fish dish; meat dish and two desserts, but suffice it to say they were all fabulous and some of them were genuinely extraordinary. I know extraordinary is a much abused phrase , but some of the dishes, particularly the final dessert can only be described that way. The wine list was very comprehensive, with quality wines from around the globe. We chose Spanish, and our choice of White (Albarinho ) and red ( a Gran reserve Rioja ) were outstanding and great value for money at about 35 Euro per bottle. There were of course cheaper wines and more expensive, but I was delighted with the quality of the wine at the price. The sommelier was great. young, knowledgable , and more about suggesting interesting wines , rather than expensive wines. We concluded our dinner with a red dessert wine, which for me was a first. Gorgeous wine and very inexpensive. The waitress was lovely, professional and a delight. As a dining experience you have to try this restaurant. It's two stars are throughly deserved and I think is exceptional value for money

review_preview: I went to Taberna el Sur on a Friday night. Due to the popularity of the place, we went early, around 8pm, and we were able to get a table right away. We wanted to try a different number of tapas and ended ordering patatas...
review_full: I went to Taberna el Sur on a Friday night. Due to the popularity of the place, we went early, around 8pm, and we were able to get a table right away. We wanted to try a different number of tapas and ended ordering patatas bravas, quiche, salmorejo, El Sur salad, the Cesar salad and the Vieja Ropa - all half portions. The food came as it was ready and it was ridiculously good. Just one warning: The portion sizes are massive!! We were so surprised but enjoyed every bite we were able to get from our self made buffet! To me, Taberna el Sur provides the real, authentic Spanish tapas experience and I would recommend every (hungry) person I know :-) The menu has a wide selection from regular tapas to the more original plates that give that 'little extra something'. It was an amazing experience and the food was fresh and nice!

title_review: Lunch Made in Heaven by an Angel
review_preview: To begin you select between three options of menu selections. Here is a photo of the one we selected. They made adjustments for my wife's allergies and dislikes without hesitation. Take a good look at the menu because it was edible. It was made of...
review_full: To begin you select between three options of menu selections. Here is a photo of the one we selected. They made adjustments for my wife's allergies and dislikes without hesitation. Take a good look at the menu because it was edible. It was made of potato and was served with a mayonnaise peanut oil. My thought went once you eat the menu with the prices you will forget how much lunch was. Now that I am writing this review and have finished lunch it was the biggest bargain. I want to come back tomorrow. With the sommelier's help I selected different wines by the glass. They are pictured here. The first course was Game Truffle with Duck Foie Gras and mushrooms. The game was Pigeon. It was served under a dome enclosing eucalyptus smoke. I have never had foie gras like this before. It tasted like it was blended so smooth that it melted in your mouth. Sometimes game birds can be gamey, not this. It was mild and delicious. " "Incredible" The butter served with the bread was " Real" and wonderful. The next was the Caviar Leaf. I hope picture does it justice. This was an etherial way to present and serve this. The leaf was actually black Caviar. It was accompanied by onion, cauliflower, light cream and potato. It is Caviar in another format, it really was shaped like a leaf with veins and short stem. The cream slightly softened the saltiness of the Caviar. It was Brilliant!!!!! Next was a "Shot" of Butter Fish with White Asparagus, seaweed Ikora with foam on top. There was a perfect balance of flavours that went on in the mouth like a great wine. Next came Celeriac cream with smoked Sardine and Apple. Also accompanied by Black Caviar and the Gold Caviar was actually made from oil not fish eggs. All the flavours worked together without any one of them overwhelming another. Even the smoked Sardine was mild. My wife was served an Onion soup over brie cheese toast. She said she loved it. I include pictures of the stages of the serving of this soup. My course was "Verdinas" beans with Cockles and Sea Urchin foam. The Cockles tasted like they just came out of the ocean. These beans are from Northern Spain. These have to be the Best I have ever had. The base of this dish was like a soup of bean pure blended with sea urchin. The fantastic quality of the ingredients was so spectacular. The Chef Mery Marte Rosario let each ingredient speak for itself, nothing getting in the way way of anything else. Egg with bread and Pancetta served over a light potato cream sauce. I cut through the egg and it flowed out like you would expect a soft boiled egg to do. The Pancetta was so mild it almost tasted like a mild salmon. In a very pleasant positive way. Each dish shows how this chef takes combinations of flavours to the "Next" level- Way beyond! The quality of the ingredients is so apparent that you can only imagine what the chef must go through to find these amazing ingredients. Red Mullet on Saffron Bullion was accompanied by artichoke, shallots and coconut foam. The shallots were so delicious and they helped bring all the dish together. Suckling Lamb Shoulder with Tandoori crumble was beyond description. The brown sauce was made from the bones of the lamb. The white sauce using a yogurt. The crumble was fine and from a cookie. The lamb was prepared medium rare but it was so tender it melted in my mouth. The skin was crispy just like you would expect from the preparation of "suckling" anything such as suckling pig. There were a couple of pieces of mini cucumber that were refreshing. This was the shoulder and yet it was the most tender and best piece of lamb I have ever had. The next course was a pallet cleanser. Hibiscus Flower with Pisco sour. It worked! The Fish Bowl was next. Everything in the bowl was made to look like something from the ocean but was made of desert ingredients, yogurt, churro, white chocolate and raspberry flavourings. In the shape of lobster clams and seashells. Great, creative and not over sweet. The Poche Egg, brown egg shell which I thought was real. Fortunately the waiter stopped me from picking it up out of curiosity.  The shell, though brown was made of white chocolate. The white of the egg was a coconut base. Delicious!!! The blackboard had dried sticks of passion fruit. The letters were made of ginger sweet bread. Thee was a biscuit which had a Yuzu mousse on it. The wines by the glass were: Terra Remota: caminante 2012  D. O. Empanorda Pezas da Portela 2011  D. O. Valdeorras Eidos Ermos 2011   D. O. Ribrio In summation: The chef's method is understated and yet it is perfection. Having this meal made me so happy. The environment. The service. The presentation.  The quality. The chef's wondrous, creative combinations. This whole experience was truly Amazing, something to be had by all.

review_preview: This restaurant is not that kind of place you would return at home and tell your friends "We casually found a wonderful restaurant". It doesn't have any sign outside, you must enter a wonderful modernist palace and ask for the Club Allard. Inside, you'll find...
review_full: This restaurant is not that kind of place you would return at home and tell your friends "We casually found a wonderful restaurant". It doesn't have any sign outside, you must enter a wonderful modernist palace and ask for the Club Allard. Inside, you'll find the real creative soul of Madrid, with funny, stunning and modern dishes which will fullfill your eyes before your mouth. If you are going to Madrid looking for touristic menus, megameals and frozen paella, then you can miss this restaurant. But if you want to experience why spanish kitchen is considered the avangarde of modern food, then book a table here, in this elegant temple of food culture. It won't be cheap, but it will be unforgettable.

title_review: Cooking taken to the very highest level.
review_preview: What a fantastic meal we had at this restaurant. Certainly one of he most memorable I have ever had in my life. We arrived just as they were starting service - 9pm. No point in going earlier - they won't let you in! But pop...
review_full: What a fantastic meal we had at this restaurant. Certainly one of he most memorable I have ever had in my life.  We arrived just as they were starting service - 9pm. No point in going earlier - they won't let you in! But pop up the road and to your left and there's quite a good little Jazz bar.  The cooking here at el Club Allard is exceptional and the attention to detail and the level of care taken to ensure every dish is technically perfect and utterly unique is quite astonishing. I'd defy any "foodie" to come here without either laughing with enthusiasm or saying "WOW" at least half a dozen times throughout the experience.  There are three different types of Tasting Menu. We went for the 12 courser - The Seduction. This comes in at €98 per person with wine on top. ( The wine caters for all budgets).  Here's what we had -  1. Soft shell crab served on a bed of smoking seaweed*. 2. Game truffle with Foie Gras and mushrooms 3. Pea ravioli with Iberique dewlap 4. Celeriac cream with smoked sardine and apple 5. Onion Soup 6. Egg with bread, pancetta, and potato cream 7. Grouper with Korean marinade 8. Suckling lamb shoulder with Tandoori crumble*.  9.Hibiscus flower with pisco sour 10. The fishbowl ( Chocolate, marshmallow, fondant)  11. Poche egg ( Chocolate, mango)*  12. The blackboard ( petit fours made with chocolate and other things) My absolute top three are starred, but all dishes were expertly presented, served and tasted delicious.  If you are serious about gastronomic experiences, you will leave this place smiling, stuffed and dreaming about a return.

review_preview: Having just come back from Madrid I felt compelled to write a review about this place as it was "FANTASTIC"Please note you can not eat before 9pm and there is no bar where you might have a pre dinner drink. Also when you arrive...
review_full: Having just come back from Madrid I felt compelled to write a review about this place as it was "FANTASTIC" Please note you can not eat before 9pm and there is no bar where you might have a pre dinner drink. Also when you arrive it looks like a an entrance to very nice apartments so please do not be put off by this. On arrival we were seated to what seemed like a private dining area which was just lovely. The staff were superb very professional and explained everything we needed to know. The service was impeccable. If your visiting Madrid make sure you book a table as you will not regret it as it was quite simply one of the best foodie experiences that I have ever had. I'm not going to say anymore as I would not want to take away the magic of this place and you will understand once you have your own experience. Thank you el Club Allard for a fantastic last night in Madrid

review_preview: I'll start at the very beginning...we booked a table at 9pm but arrived thinking there would be somewhere to wait before being seated, there's not so we stood in the pouring rain on a street corner wondering what to do for half hour then I...
review_full: I'll start at the very beginning...we booked a table at 9pm but arrived thinking there would be somewhere to wait before being seated, there's not so we stood in the pouring rain on a street corner wondering what to do for half hour then I spotted a little cafe up the road where we had a rather nice glass of wine. When we eventually got into the restaurant, it almost felt like we were entering some sort of secret society, it was all very quiet and service didn't started until everyone was seated.I half expected a Master of Ceremonies to step in and announce dinner was served!  And so the food began...course after wonderful course of unusual, very rich and inventive dishes. We had asked the Sommelier to recommend some wine so a new & delicious glass of wine came every 2 courses, Unfortunately, four courses in my Husband wasn't feeling very well and had to stop eating (nothing to do with the Restaurant food) so I sat there eating the remaining 8 courses (along with the extra wine he couldn't drink) myself and had to then go through every course in detail when he eventually could stomach the thought! I have to say though, the Restaurant were fantastic and constantly ensured he was OK, providing water and they took some money off the bill which they didn't need to do. I could go on about each course but it would spoil the surprise! I do agree with some of the other reviews regarding some of the dishes not being as good as others (esp the Eggy Bread thing - not sure about that one) but you go for the experience of a 2 Michelin Star meal accompanied by dry ice and smoke and all the quirky things you'd expect from a restaurant of this calibre. It's a great experience and if you're a real foodie like I am, you'll go regardless of what peoples reviews are. I would definitely go back again but I would probably go for one of the smaller menus, it's not that the portions were huge, it's just that the food is very rich and I started to lose myself in a heady cocktail of Cavier, Cava and Truffle, much to the embarrassment of my poorly Husband who had to escort me home!

title_review: By accident we entered this bar - Taverna: Madrid's hidden secret !!!
review_preview: Strolling back after a visit at the Retiro-park we passed this taverna. From outside you would not say it is busy inside with such good atmosphere.At the back are some tables to have a full diner, but standing at the bar you experience the...
review_full: Strolling back after a visit at the Retiro-park we passed this taverna. From outside you would not say it is busy inside with such good atmosphere. At the back are some tables to have a full diner, but standing at the bar you experience the Madrilène life style – accompanied by….TAPAS. Every drink you order comes with a different tapa. And if you refuse as we did (we do not like olives) a different one is presented. The bread slice with Spanish cheese was delicious. Actually, everything was delicious. If nearby – go there and have a break and a sip of a glass of something, like the famous vermouth or a vino tintho - or just a beer. We entered for one drink and left little tipsy and with a full belly.

review_preview: The end of September, I was on my own in Madrid, as my friend missed her flight.  Looking for a good place to eat close to my guesthouse on Calle Atocha, I saw El Alambique Taberna, and remembered that it had gotten great reviews on...
review_full: The end of September, I was on my own in Madrid, as my friend missed her flight. Looking for a good place to eat close to my guesthouse on Calle Atocha, I saw El Alambique Taberna, and remembered that it had gotten great reviews on Tripadvisor. So I stopped in for lunch, hoping that they had a good Menu del Dia. And they did! For anyone looking for a decent meal at a reasonable price, this is often a good option. I do have some basic Spanish, but decided to just let the friendly, helpful waitress and owner bring me what was on the special "menu of the day". If you are in a decent restaurant, it is fun to just go with the flow, and see what comes to your table. The first course was pimento or peppers (I think!) over spiced eggplant, and it was delicious. The second course was a huge portion of a fish that was so moist, tender, flaky and flavorful that I savored each bite. At that point, I was getting full, but couldn't bear to turn down dessert---a lovely flan with a coffee flavored topping. Delicious. All of this, plus bread and a glass of white wine for about 11-12 euros. What a deal! I did notice other Americans coming in---likely thanks to Tripadvisor---but there seemed to be a lot of locals as well, always a good sign. The atmosphere was charming, and I never felt uncomfortable as a single woman dining alone. I would definitely return---with friends to share this lovely experience!

review_preview: I was staying at the Chic and Basic on Atocha and asked for a recommendation for a local restaurant.  Boy did they ever do me right; El Alambique exactly fit the bill.  I did lunch here 2 different times and each time it was very...
review_full: I was staying at the Chic and Basic on Atocha and asked for a recommendation for a local restaurant. Boy did they ever do me right; El Alambique exactly fit the bill. I did lunch here 2 different times and each time it was very good. The gazpacho was great and they serve it with side peppers, onions, and tomatoes. The plate of the day featured meats served in good quantity at reasonable prices, It didn't matter that the owner's English was as jumbled as my Spanish; he went out of his way to help. Do not be put off, it's a small place off the Atocha close to the museums. This is a local's restaurant for all the good reasons. Seek out this place, it is worth it.

title_review: Wonderfully affordable gem near the Barrio de las Letras
review_preview: This summer I have had the pleasure of living right around the corner from this eatery, which I have visited at least once a week and to which I have taken friends for delicious lunches. The decor is simple, vintage, ecclectic (a bunch of old...
review_full: This summer I have had the pleasure of living right around the corner from this eatery, which I have visited at least once a week and to which I have taken friends for delicious lunches. The decor is simple, vintage, ecclectic (a bunch of old Flamenco dance and cantares posters, a smattering of Political paraphernalia, and the place is unabashedly an Atleti bar), the Flamenco music is understated but welcomed. For ten Euros the menu lunch is the perfect deal. Plenty of delicious food prepared by the ever hawt Chef Lourdes and served up by the dutiful Juan. They bottle their own wine and serve it up freely, and it's a great complement to all their meals.

This place knows food, the service was outstanding and I am very grateful for their accommodation on a busy night in Madrid.

review_preview: I was in Madrid on business with 3 colleagues and decided to try this restaurant.  This restaurant is amazing at every level!  It starts with the arrival:  We were greeted at the red door like in a private club.  Then they sat us at a...
review_full: I was in Madrid on business with 3 colleagues and decided to try this restaurant. This restaurant is amazing at every level! It starts with the arrival: We were greeted at the red door like in a private club. Then they sat us at a very big and private table. The chef came to say hello and welcome us in his restaurant. Then the 7 courses menu started (No menu, it is a set meal and it changes every week). Scampi with avocado ice cream as a starter, chicken with potato and pear purée, fish with pumpkin sauce,... then I just lost track and just ate... the food was just out of this world amazing. The service was completely personalized and the chef came again at the end to hear if we like the dinner.  And you would think this dinner would have been crazy expensive, well, not at all. Do not get me wrong, you can't eat for less money in Madrid, but the price for a meal like the one we had was well below expectations.  If you want a very unique food dinner experience, you have to go there. Make sure you make a reservation, they do not have many tables.

review_preview: We stumbled upon El Alambique  after visiting the Prado Museum and were SO happy that we did.  <this is exactly the restaurant you are looking for if you want a restaurant that is off thte beaten path.  It was late on a Saturday afternoon and...
review_full: We stumbled upon El Alambique after visiting the Prado Museum and were SO happy that we did. <this is exactly the restaurant you are looking for if you want a restaurant that is off thte beaten path. It was late on a Saturday afternoon and we (my husband and I and our 3 teenagers) were tired, hot and hungry. We had been looking for "local" restaurant for the last 2 days and had been somewhat dissapointed. This is exactly the restaurant you are looking for if you want a restaurant that is off the beaten path and is local - it was full of locals and others stopping by for a drink to greet the owner and the staff. The owner could not have been friendlier. While we speak some Spanish, he went out of his way to enlist a customer to help us with words we did not know and even brought out fresh beef and honey when that did not work to show us what was on the menu! Two of us got the lunch menu which at 13 euros was a great deal. My husband got the gazpacho soup (which was by far our favorite so far - they give you onions, tomoatoes, peppers and celery to put in the soup at your choosing) and a steak with carmelized onions and fries, a beer and coffee. My son ordered teh eggplant with honey which was amazing (and again, our favorite so far as we have had this) and huevos rotos (fried eggs over fries), a soda and the most amazing cheesecake that is homemade with chocolate sauce. We also had a mango salad and sanwiches that were delicious and priced well (3 euros). In addition to wonderful food, everyone was so friendly and we all left with smiles on our face. I know we will always remember this and hope to visit again.

We plan to return again.

title_review: Lovely food, great atmosphere and friendly owner
review_preview: This is a great little restaurant in a quiet street close to the main attractions in Madrid. There are always mouth-watering choices in the menu, both traditional and some more exciting or trendy, and the prices are competitive. I really like the decor, the background...
review_full: This is a great little restaurant in a quiet street close to the main attractions in Madrid. There are always mouth-watering choices in the menu, both traditional and some more exciting or trendy, and the prices are competitive. I really like the decor, the background music and the general atmosphere in the place. The owner is a friendly gentleman who will entertain you with stories of Madrid and the service in general is excellent, always willing to accommodate your needs or requests. I like it so much I've even taken a school trip to eat there!! Don't miss it if you go to Madrid!

title_review: Great Food on the Tapa Crawl

review_full: This taberna is situated in a part of Madrid known for the city's lively evening tapa crawl. It is an ideal location to add to your route. It is not one of those tourist places that serves you an overpriced drink and you have to ask for the following tapa. The food is excellent, even the chimichurri for the carne argentina. El menu del dia is a real bargain as well as ordering off the menu. I cannot say enough about the attention to detail and service here. If you want to step into a piece of authentic Madrid for excellent food and a great experience, go here.

title_review: Warm, friendly restaurant with simply divine food
review_preview: Set in an unassuming, warm and personal space, El Alambique Taberna offers some traditional Spanish foods, and some other types of Mediterranean food. While the menu is small, the food is all incredibly well prepared, and the staff are accommodating to vegetarians, which can be...
review_full: Set in an unassuming, warm and personal space, El Alambique Taberna offers some traditional Spanish foods, and some other types of Mediterranean food. While the menu is small, the food is all incredibly well prepared, and the staff are accommodating to vegetarians, which can be hard to find in Spain.  We had an Ensalada Mixta, the fried aubergine in a divine sauce, the Pastel Champiñon, and Huevos Rotos. We also managed to poke down dessert (equally tasty and also homemade).  I left incredibly full and happy. Such a lovely place and I cannot wait to return.

review_preview: Among all of the restaurants we've eaten in Spain, this is our Favorite & the best!  Found on tripadvisor & was a fantastic find for dinner.  Took a cab from our hotel in Recoletos, about 10 minutes away & inexpensive cab fare.  Our server, was...
review_full: Among all of the restaurants we've eaten in Spain, this is our Favorite & the best! Found on tripadvisor & was a fantastic find for dinner. Took a cab from our hotel in Recoletos, about 10 minutes away & inexpensive cab fare. Our server, was fantastic! we couldn't believe that we found the only 'fluent' english speaking server & she was at a authentic Spanish restaurant. It was awesome...she recommended a couple of dishes. Since there were only two of us, we ordered a couple of things.  > Huevos Rotos - Fried eggs with jamon on top of potatoes. Delicious! > Carne Argentina - grilled meat on top of potatoes. Tender & Excellent! They were huge servings...too big for two people but enough for four! I guess dinner servings are generous & prices are excellent! Overall, it was the best food & service. I will come back here the next time I'm in Madrid! I highly highly recommend!

review_preview: We found this place just up the street from our hotel on our 1st day in Madrid. We like it so much that we called in everyday either for food or a few pints of Erdinger and some Mojitos. The staff couldn't have been nicer...
review_full: We found this place just up the street from our hotel on our 1st day in Madrid. We like it so much that we called in everyday either for food or a few pints of Erdinger and some Mojitos. The staff couldn't have been nicer and we had a really good rapport with them, we even got some free Spanish lessons.  I have seen other reviews of this place saying that they were rushed through their meal and it was too expensive, we definitely did not have this experience at all. The staff are well trained and courteous, even to having to deal with a group of 5 Irish men who want to sit for hours and enjoy a few, maybe several drinks. Empty plates are cleared away promptly to allow you to relax clutter free. As for the food itself, we found it delicious and well worth the price. Highlights for me were the Gambas, the Bravas, the Albondigas and the Choricitos.

title_review: Served raw chicken. Bad service. Avoid.
review_preview: We visited Tapa Tapa for dinner this afternoon. The restaurant initially looked inviting, modern and clean. That's about the only positives I can say about it. The service was slow and not particularly friendly. We ordered a selection of tapas and a few drinks. Four...
review_full: We visited Tapa Tapa for dinner this afternoon. The restaurant initially looked inviting, modern and clean. That's about the only positives I can say about it. The service was slow and not particularly friendly. We ordered a selection of tapas and a few drinks. Four of the fives tapas plates were just OK, nothing special. The fifth, the Chilli Pollo, was massively undercooked. It was cold, gooey, and bloody. Definitely not the way chicken should be cooked. The waitress took the plate away and said a new one would be provided. By the time it arrived, almost half an hour later, we'd already finished our meal. We had to ask for the bill three times before they brought it. Would seriously not recommend this place! Avoid Tapa Tapa unless you're looking to get food poisoning.

review_preview: Hi, I visited this restaurant after previously going to another Tapa Tapa in Barcelona. I am vegetarian and knew that I had had a good experience in Barcelona and thought I would be fine.I ordered the vegetarian croquettes and my boyfriend ordered the ham...
review_full: Hi, I visited this restaurant after previously going to another Tapa Tapa in Barcelona. I am vegetarian and knew that I had had a good experience in Barcelona and thought I would be fine. I ordered the vegetarian croquettes and my boyfriend ordered the ham croquettes. Luckily I opened mine up before eating to double check, I was unsure they were vegetarian so asked two separate waitresses who both said they were vegetarian. I then ate some trusting them and could immediately taste the meat. I went to the manager to ask and he said yes they are the meat ones. They were on the wrong colour coded plate. Completely ruined my lunch as I didn’t want to eat anything else.  We asked the manager what he could do and he took the croquettes off the bill however paying €32 for a meal that we had barely eaten when I was visibly upset (I have been vegetarian for 15 years) still seemed unfair to me. I asked the manager for his name and he carried on avoiding me however he printed our bill so we have his name. I will be in touch with Tapa Tapa about him and this experience.

When we arrived it was buzzing with a mixture of tourists and a few locals, all waiting for a table or eating their tapas at the bar. We waited for around 20 minutes with a jug of sangria (would recommend) before sitting at a cosy table by the window. If you are looking for an authentic Spanish taberna experience with friendly staff and great food then this is the place. The menu was in Spanish and English which was useful for us, and the waitress advised that half portions were available which meant we could order and taste a bigger selection of dishes. Everything we ordered tasted great, and it seemed like everyone around us was enjoying theirs too. It was very reasonably priced as well which was a bonus. I would advise to either arrive a little early or be prepared to wait. Several groups walked in and straight back out whilst we were there, purely due to the number of customers in such a small place. But it was definitely worth the wait and I would recommend anyone visiting Madrid to add it to their list of places to eat.

title_review: More expensive tapas, but still very affordable and outright delicious!
review_preview: Went there after a lunch elsewhere since we wanted tortillas for our last day in Madrid and where we were they only served french omelette. Waiter said Juana La Loca had the best tortillas in the whole of Madrid (in the whole of Spain according...
review_full: Went there after a lunch elsewhere since we wanted tortillas for our last day in Madrid and where we were they only served french omelette. Waiter said Juana La Loca had the best tortillas in the whole of Madrid (in the whole of Spain according to the waiters of Juana La Loca itself) and to be honest, they cannot be far off!  Upon entering we immediately felt sorry for not having discovered this place sooner...! All tapas looked delicious. They are big yet sophisticated. They are not cheap though (6,5 on average for normal tapas, around 10 for "luxury tapas").  We checked the menu and although we only came for the tortilla, we decided to order a luxury tapas (butterfish sashimi with bean sprouts, black truffle, asparagus and a creamy sauce) + a dessert (dulche con lecche - sort of moelleux with caramel inside - with banana ice cream). Both were DI-VI-NE...!!!!! Dessert was beating all the ones we had had so far during our stay and, believe me, we've had some good ones. Also, staff was very friendly.  All in all surprised that this is ranking so low in TripAdvisor. Deserves higher ranking in my book. Next time in Madrid we definitely go back to this place to have more.

The kitchen is open until midnight, so it is a great place for late night food.  There was a small Spanish jazz cafe bar down the road nearby where we spent the time.  Once we got our table the menu looked good. There is a selection of main plates (some are available as half portions, if you want to have more of a tapas-style dinner) as well as appetizers and tapas. The tapas selection itself is small (six items) but we supplemented with an appetizer (ham croquettes - fantastic!), a cheese plate, and a half portion of the ropa vieja and it was more than enough food for two.  From the tapas menu we ordered moussaka, quiche, patatas bravas, and salmorejo (a cold creamy tomato soup with ham). The salmorejo was particularly delicious, especially with the fresh bread served. The patatas bravas were not the best we’ve had (very smoky flavor) but everything else was excellent.  The sangria was fantastic, so much so that we ordered a second jug.  This cost us €66 which I think is pretty good value for money.  We would definitely return when in Madrid again.

title_review: Incredibly good, food, atmosphere, service all perfect
review_preview: This tapas bar was recommended in the book Where Chefs Eat and it didn't disappoint. We turned up without a booking about 9.30 and I think we got lucky finding a lull between early eating tourists and late eating locals. Others were not so lucky....
review_full: This tapas bar was recommended in the book Where Chefs Eat and it didn't disappoint. We turned up without a booking about 9.30 and I think we got lucky finding a lull between early eating tourists and late eating locals. Others were not so lucky. We speak no Spanish so having an English version of the menu was a godsend. The staff in general do not speak English but will find you the one who does speak a bit if necessary. We had four tapas for two people: tortilla, vegetable cerviche, cheese and bacon quesadilla, and suckling pig. All were outstanding with the tortilla the best I have had in Spain (and I eat it at least once a day), the marinated vegetables a tasty surprise in a city that seems to abhor vegetables, the quesadilla a fine balance between good cheese and bacon and fresh tomato salsa. But the pig was the thing, melting meat attached to crispy skin and served with suitably peppery rocket and a potato thing. This was quite simply a triumph and one of the best single dishes i have ever eaten. For tapas this is expensive, the meal with a few drinks was 43 euros. But it is still brilliant value and a clear foodie choice.

review_preview: I walked in here at about 8 PM without reservations. They seated me without a fuss but the only people I saw in there - one table when I walked in and a bunch of people after were clearly tourists based on whether they made...
review_full: I walked in here at about 8 PM without reservations. They seated me without a fuss but the only people I saw in there - one table when I walked in and a bunch of people after were clearly tourists based on whether they made reservations or not. The few locals who came either stood at the counter or ordered a drink and then sat at a table, however, I am not disparaging this restaurant, just saying if you want to blend in with locals, come later. The waitstaff were all young men with relatively good english who are obviously used to tourists. Still they were hot and the recommendations were good.  The food was excellent; I had steak on bread topped with a quail egg, the artichokes on bread with parmesan (both hot) and the baby eels in a spinach roll (cold), washed down with a glass of house red and then 2 beers. All were exceedingly tasty and the bill while large for tapas places (about 30 euro), was truly tasty and good. It's takes a little work to find, you have a to walk past the market to an unassuming corner. The day before I tried to go there but around 7 and it looked like the restaurant had closed down. Luckily I went back and the point is you really just have to just come late enough.

review_preview: A friend of ours had said to us "If there is one place you should go for tapas in Madrid, it's Juana La Loca."  We now completely understand why he said that. The place sits unassumingly in a street corner in the Latina quarter. You...
review_full: A friend of ours had said to us "If there is one place you should go for tapas in Madrid, it's Juana La Loca."  We now completely understand why he said that. The place sits unassumingly in a street corner in the Latina quarter. You could easily walk past it and miss the most tantalising food experience of your lifetime. Fortunately that does not happen, because as soon as you venture near the open restaurant door on a Friday or Saturday night you get helplessly sucked in by a heady vortex of animated Spanish conversation, the clink of wine glasses punctuating the sounds of laughter over drum and bass, and the insanely earthy, smoky and sweet aromas wafting out of the kitchen and the bar. The place has this organic thrum to it; you instinctively recognise that somewhere in this restaurant beats the heart of Madrid.  We visited Juana La Loca twice. On those two precious opportunities I sampled the entire menu. And it was good. It was all good. This is not your traditional chorizo and tortilla tapas joint. Fresh Spanish produce is pushed to the extreme here, but always done with simplicity and minimalist artistic flair. Clearly taste and freshness are paramount, with stunning visual impact following close behind. Seared foie gras with candied hazelnuts. Black fideua and squid butifarra. That tortilla with caramelised onion. Oh that tortilla. That tortilla puts the world right. On both occasions we were served by Dani el Venezolano. His level of service is beyond measure... and he also prepares the best mojitos in town. I'll end this here with a few words a friend of ours told us before we went on holiday to Madrid: "If there is one place you should go for tapas in Madrid, it's Juana La Loca."

title_review: one of the best sangria in madrid
review_preview: Taberna el Sur is among the best places we have eaten in Madrid. Though it was difficult to find and we could not find it without GPS since it was in the middle of intersection of small streets, it was worth the effort. We have...
review_full: Taberna el Sur is among the best places we have eaten in Madrid. Though it was difficult to find and we could not find it without GPS since it was in the middle of intersection of small streets, it was worth the effort. We have been there because it was close to our hotel and had so many good comments. We liked there so much that we have been there every night in our 4 day trip. First of all, the service is very good. The staff is friendly, fast and speak English very well. The waiter you see in the photos is a very kind man and we chatted with him quite a lot. He prepares excellent sangrias! We had the one of the best sangrias we had in Spain here.  We first went to El Sur to have some snacks and tried a couple of tapas and dishes. After that, we have been there every night in our 4 day trip and liked almost everything we have tried. The only thing we could not manage to eat was king prawns since they were in high demand and they did not have any left whenever we requested. But they looked really good! Still, the most outstanding item was sangria for me. Though taste was not unique and changing from night to night (and best one being prepared by the waiter in the photo!), it was really really good.   Regarding the prices, El Sur is a place cheaper than many other places in the same category. Thus, it is a small but nice place where you can eat good food, drink a very delicious sangria and pay a smaller amount compared to other places.  If you are in the neighbourhood, you should definitely try here!

title_review: Best meal in a month of Italy and Spain
review_preview: My friend and I found this restaurant through trip advisor and we were incredibly happy with everything we ordered. We asked for advice from the waiter on what and how much to order and his suggestions were perfect. Between 2 people, we shared 1/2 portions...
review_full: My friend and I found this restaurant through trip advisor and we were incredibly happy with everything we ordered. We asked for advice from the waiter on what and how much to order and his suggestions were perfect. Between 2 people, we shared 1/2 portions of the risotto and the curry chicken and a full order of the steak. Each dish was so amazing that it was sad to eat the last bite. We also shared the cheesecake and passion fruit cake - normally I would say plain cheesecake is a bit boring but this far exceeded my expectations. Our waiter was also very helpful on drink suggestions and both the wine and sangria were perfect. Our meal came to about 45 euros for everything which was a very good deal considering both the quality and quantity of food. If I lived in Madrid, I would eat here on a regular basis.

review_preview: Juana La Loca is a phenomenal tapas bar that my wife and I visited for dinner recently. Since all of the tables were either taken or reserved, we ate at the bar (standing only). We ordered a couple beers and a few pintxos. We started...
review_full: Juana La Loca is a phenomenal tapas bar that my wife and I visited for dinner recently. Since all of the tables were either taken or reserved, we ate at the bar (standing only). We ordered a couple beers and a few pintxos. We started with the Nuestra Tortilla de Papas y Cebolla Confitada which is a savory Spanish tortilla with potato, eggs, and onions. Next we had the Jamon de Pato which is flavorful cured duck meat. Finally we had the Ravilolo de Scamorza y Pisto de Berenjas con Bacon Crujiente y Pan de Oliva Negra which was an olive mixture topped with melty cheese and crisp bacon. This bar is a must visit when in Madrid.

review_full: We have enjoyed many great meals out in Madrid, and this was quite possibly the best, went there with daughter 21 and son 18, and the wife, arrived around 9.30 and booked a table for about 10pm, we were seated around 10.20, extremely busy and run by Filippo at front of house, who was the consummate pro! And extremely helpful. This place is all about Pintxos (similar to tapas) most dishes were for one and some for 2 but they all shared so we all had some of everything.  We ordered 6 different dishes, 3 seafood and 3 meat,and they were so clever and original, we started with a can of tuna tartar with a sprinkling of wasabi, 5 cantabrian anchovies and toast, just so good, and then a fideua negro with squid sausages, 4 duck pancake rolls absolutely stuffed with duck, some Iberico pork and then a delicious mini steak burger, each dish intricately assembled, we had 3 deserts 2 chocolate mouses and a lemon pie, all delicious was the verdict. With this we had 3 glasses of wine and 4 beers and a 2 cokes (mostly while waiting for our table!) and really nice bottle of Albariño wine. (€22) with the meal. The whole bill was about £120 so £30per head, the food was delicious but we should probably have ordered 2 or 3 more dishes as we all felt we could have eaten more! The prices certainly reflected the quality of food.

title_review: Best Restaurant in Madrid = Juana La Loca
review_preview: Visiting Spain from New York City I was on a quest with friends to find some unbelievable food. Visiting Juana La Loca surpassed that goal, the food was mind blowing. Let’s start with the atmosphere... cozy, beautiful decor and the nicest staff around, you’ll feel...
review_full: Visiting Spain from New York City I was on a quest with friends to find some unbelievable food. Visiting Juana La Loca surpassed that goal, the food was mind blowing.  Let’s start with the atmosphere... cozy, beautiful decor and the nicest staff around, you’ll feel like you’re getting a genuine Spanish experience with a homey but upscale feel.  The food is well worth the prices (which are very reasonable) and everything about it is perfect. The texture, taste, aroma... phenomenal. The Tortilla (Spanish Omelette) is the best I’ve had from every place I’d eaten in Spain. So I my books, Juana has the best Tortilla de Patata in the whole country. The chivito is a close second favorite, but really everything on the menu is worth a try.  If you’re visiting Madrid, Juana should be a required stop, trust me, there’s no better place you’ll eat on your entire trip!!

title_review: Great staff, great food and reasonable prices!
review_preview: My friend and I were in Madrid on holiday and we found this place on Trip Advisor, it lived up to the reviews we had read! The food was traditional, not fancy but delicious! Totally Spanish and cheap! The wine was great too and €3...
review_full: My friend and I were in Madrid on holiday and we found this place on Trip Advisor, it lived up to the reviews we had read! The food was traditional, not fancy but delicious! Totally Spanish and cheap! The wine was great too and €3 a glass, the Albariño was my favourite white wine! The thing we liked the most was the staff, they were so friendly and attentive, always there checking everything is alright and topping up drinks! It looks like a group of friends running the place and it makes for such a nice atmosphere! They even gave us a little digestif after our meal and 3 of the staff joined us to do a shot! So we went back on our final night and they seemed pleased we had returned! The solomillo el sur was delicious, pork in a moscatel sauce! We also really liked the salad with orange which we shared as a starter. We didn't have tapas as a meal but tried the croquetas de jamon the second time we went as it was a bit early for dinner and they were yummy too! Every Madrid bar seems to have its regulars and at El Sur there's an old guy who sits at the bar alone. He drew a picture of my friend while we were eating which was a bit strange but he was harmless really! She kept the picture as a souvenir!

review_preview: This restaurant is working overtime on their TripAdvisor rating and given wide assortment of great places in Madrid, you can easily skip this. In fact, I don't use TA for restaurant recommendations for this very reason.Located just off the beaten tourist path from the...
review_full: This restaurant is working overtime on their TripAdvisor rating and given wide assortment of great places in Madrid, you can easily skip this. In fact, I don't use TA for restaurant recommendations for this very reason. Located just off the beaten tourist path from the main center, easy enough to find and cute narrow classic interior. But don't expect to find any Spanish people eating here. Service was marginal and my Spanish friend was shocked when the waiter laid down a bill as we finished our meal without asking (including a card asking that we leave a review - so here is it!) Food was simply OK, nothing special and prices typical inner city, a bit expensive for what it was. Seating is a bit uncomfortable.  Overall, Madrid is super easy to get around, go to some further out area of the center (15 mins) and you'll find a more authentic experience and warmer service.

review_preview: There are some problems with using map applications on smart phones when visiting older cities in Europe.  Last evening  for example in Madrid I experienced  some difficulty in finding Taberna El Sur. We were staying in the Huertas area of Madrid and the restaurant was...
review_full: There are some problems with using map applications on smart phones when visiting older cities in Europe. Last evening for example in Madrid I experienced some difficulty in finding Taberna El Sur. We were staying in the Huertas area of Madrid and the restaurant was tauntily close, a mere ten minute walk away. Due to construction on Calle Atocha as well as navigating a 6 way intersection, the phone app showed us as being at our destination or being 5 minutes away, or just by turning around extending our ETA by an additional 5 minutes. The solution was to keep walking around down one street up another until we found ourselves outside the door of our destination. Dizzy when you are hungry but definitely worth the trouble when the restaurant proved itself outstanding. The actual Taberna is small with a bar and sidewall of tables and benches extending to the back. We were presented with a handwritten suggestion for the meal available for that evening but opted for the standard menu and wine listing by the glass. We had decided to share the plates and order more if our appetites were too large. We started with a Mediterranean Salad which included orange slices and pitted green olives, as well as an order of grilled squid with Spanish salad with some fresh corn. My wife had a glass of Rose while I had a fine Rioja. Everthing was excellent. Our server Jose was super attentive and knowledgable. Still hungry we opted for shrimps in garlic sauce as well as patatas bravas which were covered in a fine tomato sauce with smoked paprika. Two different red Riojas were also consumed. There was some good hot bread for dipping in the sauces. We followed this up with some Cava served in a flute glass with a blackberry in each which spun as it trapped the bubbles. We also received a complementary cheesecake as well as 2 almond cream liqueurs. All of this for just over 40 Euros.  You have to go. Exceptional food and service.

Our first tapas included the squid and an insalata and I chose the only Rosée on the wine menu. If you like wine it was a superb choice. The next course included shrimp and patatas brava with a recommended red Sancho Garces ...super Delicious! You know service is good when the waiter can quickly evaluate your style and recommends choices that you will like. Jose did exactly that and his choices were great both for wine and food. I noticed that everyone on the staff was working hard to respond to all the clients. I am really grateful that we were offered complimentary cheesecake with our sparkling wine which was delicious and liqueurs on the house. This is a gem! Thank you!

title_review: Creative, fresh, and well-priced Spanish food (Great for vegetarians!)
review_preview: The restaurant is very small with only about 10 tables of 2, so it is essential to get a reservation or be one of the first in line when the doors open at 20:00. We went right when it opened, and at the time the...
review_full: The restaurant is very small with only about 10 tables of 2, so it is essential to get a reservation or be one of the first in line when the doors open at 20:00. We went right when it opened, and at the time the restaurant was very quiet and intimate.  The menu items are unique, bold, and very well priced. There is a large section of pinxos for <10€ and then a section of larger plates that can be split between two people (10-15€). As a vegetarian, I found plenty of great options.  We split zucchini rolls filled with cod, cheese ravioli pinxo stuffed with sautéed eggplant and topped with smoked paprika, grilled artichoke topped with fresh Parmesan and garlic, baked cheesy gnocchi, and wild mushroom and truffle ravioli. I’m not sure which was my favorite! If I ever come back to Madrid, this will be my first stop!

review_preview: It's trendy it's crowded it's noisy and not to be missed! After viewing the paintings of the tragic mad Queen at the Prado head over to the lovely La Latina neighborhood for the most exciting tapas in Madrid. You can fight the crowd at the...
review_full: It's trendy it's crowded it's noisy and not to be missed! After viewing the paintings of the tragic mad Queen at the Prado head over to the lovely La Latina neighborhood for the most exciting tapas in Madrid. You can fight the crowd at the bar but it's best to put your name on the list for a table and enjoy a glass of wine or beer while you wait. The turnover is quick so the wait is not usually long as it's always packed with locals jostling for space at the bar. While not cheap the tapas are outstanding. Our favorites are the soft shell crab and the cochinillo crugiente which is roasted succulent pork with crispy skin. Accompanied by the wonderful spidery fried artichokes they make a meal as the portions are generous. Be sure to order everything you want when placing your order as the waiters are quite busy and move at lightning speed so catching their attention again can be challenging until the order arrives at your table. Don't be shy and just squeeze your way to the register to add your name to the list when you arrive and you will be rewarded with the most imaginative and tasty tapas that Madrid has to offer ... Que viva la Reina!

title_review: Nice place with lounge atmosphere in the evening
review_preview: Both had lunch and dinner here.  At lunch the atmosphere was nice and not to noisy. Good service - You get at lot of attention. They are famed for their tortilla with sweet onions - try it - It's good and god value as well....
review_full: Both had lunch and dinner here. At lunch the atmosphere was nice and not to noisy. Good service - You get at lot of attention. They are famed for their tortilla with sweet onions - try it - It's good and god value as well. You cannot make a reservation after 9 PM, but You get your name on the waiting list, a relax in the bar. I was waiting less that half an hour, enjoying the nice buzz and music. Sweetbread was very good. A beautiful looking, delicate, tasteful dish. Ravioli with truffles was very good as well. I found the roastbeef to be too vulgar, big and soft. The other dishes had the contrast in textures - crunch and soft, which is what we want... An ok bottle of Ribera with some maturity for an ok price. The withe chocolate desert with raspberry was also nice. They can cook and they have good service and atmosphere. They have some good bottles of wine like Mauro, but they have got a extremely limited selection of sherry; One mainstream Manzanilla and Fino (Tio Pepe) and one PX. The wines by the glass are not very impressive... But all in all a place I would be happy to return to.

review_preview: My wife and I wanted to find something close to our hotel and saw the high ratings for Taberna el Sur so we decided to give it a try and happy that we did!It's a small place that's hopping with energy and filled with...
review_full: My wife and I wanted to find something close to our hotel and saw the high ratings for Taberna el Sur so we decided to give it a try and happy that we did! It's a small place that's hopping with energy and filled with patrons around dinner time. We had a small 20min wait which wasn't a big deal. The wait and bar staff are pleasant and helpful. My wife ordered the El Sur salad, which we shared and really enjoyed - if you're a goat cheese, walnut and balsamic dressing fan - you should love this one. My wife ordered the Solomillo Sur as a main and she loved it - very tasty and good portion size, not too big/too small, just right! I ordered their special - Paella Mixta, which was also really tasty. Definitely recommend it!! Two thumbs up!!!

review_preview: Had lunch today.  Was surprised it was not crowded but we beat the crowd as we were there early for Spain around 1:30. It was packed at 2:30 on this Saturday.  Had a nice bottle of tempranillo for 16.5 e along with the El Sur...
review_full: Had lunch today. Was surprised it was not crowded but we beat the crowd as we were there early for Spain around 1:30. It was packed at 2:30 on this Saturday. Had a nice bottle of tempranillo for 16.5 e along with the El Sur salad, prawns in garlic and cuban shredded flank steak. Everything was really good. Had tres leche cake for desert with some expresso. Whole bill 50 e. Quite a bargain for what we had along with the wonderful flavors. Everyone seemed to be enjoying their experience at El Sur and when we come back through Madrid to go home in 3 weeks we will definitely go back. So far, our best meal in Spain.

title_review: A great experience-A must try in Madrid!
review_preview: A friend had recommended this restaurant and we were very glad we went.  The owner/manager was extremely helpful in making sure our group had a great dining experience.  We all felt very special in our treatment.  The restaurant is small, and had a group of...
review_full: A friend had recommended this restaurant and we were very glad we went. The owner/manager was extremely helpful in making sure our group had a great dining experience. We all felt very special in our treatment. The restaurant is small, and had a group of about 10 persons and we were given a private room in the back.  They were extremely helpful in making recommendations from the menu. I never in my imagination would have eaten ox tail, but on the recommendation of the manager, I tried it. I was very glad I did. It was very good.  Everyone in our group really enjoyed the meal and felt it was one of the highlights of their trip. We would definitely return to this restaurant on another trip to Madrid.  It is not expensive, I would definitely suggest reservations. If you just want tapas it is a great little tapas bar as well.

review_preview: We were looking for a good tapas place in La Latina and found Juana  La Loca on Google with great reviews so decided to give it a try.   It's a small place and it was packed when we arrived around 9. None the less they...
review_full: We were looking for a good tapas place in La Latina and found Juana La Loca on Google with great reviews so decided to give it a try. It's a small place and it was packed when we arrived around 9. None the less they had us seated in less than 5 minutes. There were 3 of us and we ordered the tortilla Espanola which came out almost instantly, followed by the Juana la loca salad, the duck confit, the huevos rotos, and the ham croquettes. Everything was absolutely delicious. The dressing on the salad was really special. Having said that, when it was time to order one more tapas, we ordered another huevos rotos. Ah-mazing. The three of us shared the dolce de leche volcano for dessert. What a great way to end a delicious meal! To top it off we had great service. Highly recommended.

review_preview: As a tapas-lover from London in Madrid for a week, this was the best meal I found. There are many places with spectacular one-off specialties (particulary Iberico hams), but Tapa Tapa has a plethora of delicious little dishes at very fair prices. The brochetas in...
review_full: As a tapas-lover from London in Madrid for a week, this was the best meal I found. There are many places with spectacular one-off specialties (particulary Iberico hams), but Tapa Tapa has a plethora of delicious little dishes at very fair prices. The brochetas in particular are very special. As a beer afficionado as well I’m very glad to say this restaurant offers Estrella as opposed to the weaker dishwater lagers found in many other places. The Arenal restaurant has friendly staff, is very clean and is in a tremendous location. We returned and I’m sure you will too! Highly recommended!

review_preview: My partner and I were using TA to find a place for lunch between our visit to the Botanical Gardens and Museo Reina Sofia.  We saw the reviews to El Alambique and were so happy to have found it.  The owner/host was lovely - so...
review_full: My partner and I were using TA to find a place for lunch between our visit to the Botanical Gardens and Museo Reina Sofia. We saw the reviews to El Alambique and were so happy to have found it. The owner/host was lovely - so friendly and welcoming. The atmosphere is awesome - eclectic, authentic and cozy, with great music playing. My partner ordered from the menu of the day - a tuna/roasted pepper salad and then an assortment of fish. All delicious. I ordered a Greek salad, which was huge. Maybe not traditional, but I knew that going in! We had two glass of wine each, but were only charged for one each as my partner did not want a coffee or dessert which came with the menu of the day. Awesome! By the time we left the place was bustling and the owner was really busy, but still calm and so welcoming and unflappable!!!! If we had found this place sooner we would have gone a few times!!! Definitely recommend.

title_review: Raw chicken and bad follow up
review_preview: Was at Tapa Tapa Arenal for the second time in one week. For €6 we got two chicken skewers, which I think is a completely fair price. My dad had already eaten one of the two chicken skewers, and I decided to cut open the...
review_full: Was at Tapa Tapa Arenal for the second time in one week. For €6 we got two chicken skewers, which I think is a completely fair price. My dad had already eaten one of the two chicken skewers, and I decided to cut open the other one. It wasn't just a little pink or rosé in the middle, no this piece of chicken was completely raw. Misstakes happen, so I called the waitress to inform her about the chicken skewer. The waitress told me it looked raw because of the way the chicken was grilled. I told her that doesn't explain why it is entirely raw throughout. She started laughing and said "So what do you want me to do now, you have eaten almost the whole dish," referring to the skewer my dad already ate. We didn't expect her to give us an entire new dish or any discounts, just say sorry for the misstake the kitchen made and give us ONE SINGLE not raw chicken skewer. In the end, we were charged for the entire chicken dish, although we couldn't eat half of it. For 30€ per person I expect to not have to worry about eating raw chicken and getting sick. Horrible service that laughed in my face when I showed her the chicken I was served was raw. I do realise that salmonella sounds a bit Spanish, but I don't want to take it home with me as a souvenir from Madrid.

Had we know about this restaurant before our departure day, we would definitely have gone back for more!

title_review: Perfect Place for the Tapa Neophyte
review_preview: Our trip included lots of tapas restaurants but most of them were less than satisfying because the choices were limited and the language barrier was always present.Tapa Tapa was a refreshing find.  Their placemats and menus offer photos, full descriptions in English and a...
review_full: Our trip included lots of tapas restaurants but most of them were less than satisfying because the choices were limited and the language barrier was always present. Tapa Tapa was a refreshing find. Their placemats and menus offer photos, full descriptions in English and a wide variety of choices. The dishes were generous, reasonably priced and delicious. We especially liked the tuna and salmon plates. There are probably better tapas restaurants in Madrid, but unless your dinner mate speaks fluent Spanish and is a gourmet to boot, this is a good place for the beginning tapa lover.

All in all- good food and comfortable space, if you want a little more ambiance, ask to be seated by the large open doors.

title_review: Friendly, nice set menu but don't bother with a la carte
review_preview: They do a set menu at lunchtime for 10.50. this includes a starter, a main, a drink and a dessert or coffee. For the price this is good. The options are of course quite simplistic, what battered fish, egg and chips, but good and as...
review_full: They do a set menu at lunchtime for 10.50. this includes a starter, a main, a drink and a dessert or coffee. For the price this is good. The options are of course quite simplistic, what battered fish, egg and chips, but good and as you would expect for the price of the set menu. I asked about an item from the a la carte menu, which they took to mean I was ordering it. It turned up unexpectedly, before anyone else had ordered when I was away from the table, so the other person at my table didn't send it back. It was the mushroom 'pie' - which was actually just a small dish of cheap white mushrooms cooked in cream for nearly the whole price of the set menu. Another dish I had enquired about (but definitely not ordered, I just asked what it was) also turned up unexpectedly at the table a little later. I was present this time so told them that I had just asked about it, and not ordered it. It was unclear if this was a genuine misunderstanding or if they just hoped we would be too polite to send back the a la carte items. I hope it was the former, but having tried one of the a la carte items I would suggest others don't bother as the are pretty poor for the price. Still, the décor and atmosphere was nice and the staff was pleasant and friendly.

Meatballs with potatoes were interesting and a Caesar salad with chicken was one of the better caesars I have had. Squid in beer batter and grilled paprika were serviceable , but not memorable. Don't think of it as traditional Tapas , more of a tourist adapted Tapas.

title_review: Eclectic selection of wines, international fusion dishes, a beautiful setting.
review_preview: My partner and I went here on the recommendation of a friend, and we couldn’t have been happier with our experience. It’s refreshing to have a real wine bar in town. The wine list is expansive, and there are bottles from all over Europe. The...
review_full: My partner and I went here on the recommendation of a friend, and we couldn’t have been happier with our experience. It’s refreshing to have a real wine bar in town. The wine list is expansive, and there are bottles from all over Europe. The prices range from around 20-25 to the more expensive end of the spectrum, so it’s perfect for those looking for a nice easy wine to have with the dishes during lunch or dinner, or really good wine, for a special occasion.  We loved the fact that there was a sommelier explaining the origin and history of each bottle… again.. quite refreshing. I can only thing of previous trips to France where such emphasis and thought was put into the selection. This isn’t a restaurant with wine, more a Wine bar with food.  Like the wines, the dishes had international influences and inspiration, from empanadas to hummus, croquetas, and ceviche, each dish had a perfect wine to match. We left with a full stomach and a smile on our faces, and we will definitely be coming back to this place.

review_preview: For almost three months of living in Spain, particularly in Madrid.  Believe me or not, I have been to this amazing restaurant for the 4th time! It’s has been always great!These are what made my total dining experience to the Top!1. Mr. ANTONIO,...
review_full: For almost three months of living in Spain, particularly in Madrid. Believe me or not, I have been to this amazing restaurant for the 4th time! It’s has been always great! These are what made my total dining experience to the Top! 1. Mr. ANTONIO, he is one the staff heads. I believe so.. His knowledge and attitude towards customers satisfaction renders an epitome of class in dining. He was always on point and made sure that our stay from the beginning towards the end was an absolute perfection! He will make sure that you feel belonged in the restaurant as if you have never been before. 2. Every dish signified complete representation of plating, from the protein to the sauce and even the garnish. The touch of flavor and flare! 3. The standard quality of the dishes may look very expensive but the always result, it’s very very affordable! 3. There are so many compliments from the house, they have never failed to surprise me. I almost forgot the table setting and decoration, simplicity is beauty! The lighting system of the restaurant is so soft and very comfortable to the eyes. What else I can say, my comments are never enough. 4. The consistency and high class training skills of the staff are mind blowing, they are quick to respond, always smiling, devoted and they treat everyone with respect. Yes, it can be busy most of the time but believe me, they never lose control!

review_preview: I recently had the pleasure to dine again at La Castela. You definitely need to book in advance if you want to sit in the restaurant area, otherwise you have to dine in the bar area (which tends to be pretty crowded and rather noisy)....
review_full: I recently had the pleasure to dine again at La Castela. You definitely need to book in advance if you want to sit in the restaurant area, otherwise you have to dine in the bar area (which tends to be pretty crowded and rather noisy). We shared a few excellent fished and vegetables based starters, and two impressive fish based mains. We agreed that the bacalao cooked with three types of tomatoes was the best dish we picked. The wine selection is also pretty decent and the overall slightly retro atmosphere grand. Service is quick and attentive. We thoroughly enjoyed coming back to la Castela and I would definitely recommend it to anyone passing by Madrid.

Another trick we used for our second visit was to schedule a dinner in the backroom (where you can order everything!). The attendant was extremely nice, made us pan con tomate and aperol spritzs which were both not on the menu, and made recommendations. Every dish impressed our family!

review_preview: I’ve visited taberna Laredo for dinner both in the bar and in the restaurant and it is just fantastic. The quality of all the dishes I’ve tried is great, we have always ordered to share and I think if you’re having a group dinner that’s...
review_full: I’ve visited taberna Laredo for dinner both in the bar and in the restaurant and it is just fantastic. The quality of all the dishes I’ve tried is great, we have always ordered to share and I think if you’re having a group dinner that’s the best way to try several things and not just a starter an a main course. The rabbit ribs are amazing, different to any other rabbit cooking I’ve ever tried. The omelette with fried artichokes makes the artichokes to be more relevant than the omelette, even people who said they did not like the artichokes they had those. The fried calamari (rabas) with ali oli, were delicious and the meat, a t-bone to share was well cooked and high quality. Honestly I did not find a single dish that I could say was not over average. Very good desserts too. The wine list is really interesting with non mainstream options good and affordable. The service was good although the place was not crowded when we visited it so I can’t tell how would that work over the weekend. Great option I’d definitely recommend.

review_full: Cuando llamé para reservar mesa sabía que no me había equivocado. Amabilidad, cercanía y un completísimo y cuidado brunch en un antiguo y acogedor estudio de arquitectura en la travesía de Conde Duque (Madrid). Estupendo maridaje de dulces, embutidos leoneses, queso de Zamora y tortillas de mascarpone o pera. Para enamorar dulcemente a tu pareja o disfrutar de los amigos sin prisas... Yo lo hice aprendiendo de mi hija. No dejéis de visitarlo (reserva casi imprescindible) When I called to reserve a table I knew I had not been wrong. Friendliness, closeness and a complete and careful brunch in an old and cozy architecture studio in the Conde Duque crossing (Madrid). Great pairing of sweets, cold meat of León, Zamora cheese and mascarpone or pear tortillas. To sweetly fall in love with your partner or enjoy your friends without hurry ... I did it by learning from my daughter. Do not forget to visit it (reservation almost essential)

review_preview: Restaurante Santceloni is a real gem! My family and I arrived here at 8 p.m. for dinner at this 2 Michelin-starred restaurant. Located in the 5-star Hyatt hotel Hesperia Madrid, the restaurant was famous throughout Spain for its signature cuisine and exquisite dishes.As soon...
review_full: Restaurante Santceloni is a real gem! My family and I arrived here at 8 p.m. for dinner at this 2 Michelin-starred restaurant. Located in the 5-star Hyatt hotel Hesperia Madrid, the restaurant was famous throughout Spain for its signature cuisine and exquisite dishes. As soon as we arrived, a staff member with a suit greeted us and asked us whether we would like valet parking. We happily accepted, and he drove our car to the parking lot. When we entered the restaurant, a waiter led us to our table. It was beautiful, and the table looked like it was fit for the royal family. However, the seats did not match, which did make sense as the reservation was hastily made 12 hours in advance. The waiter was exceptionally kind and offered us water service and a personal breadbasket preparation.  I ordered a "Young Goat" as my main course and a "White Chocolate Creamy" as the dessert. The goat was incredibly juicy and tasty; I didn't even need a knife as it was so tender. The smoke on the hazelnut was great, and the sweetness of the roast pumpkin matched the umami of the goat. The dessert was just as great. The sweetness of the white chocolate with the freshness of the passion fruit was heavenly.  Overall, this is, by far, my favorite Michelin-starred restaurant(so far). I'd give the ambiance a 5, food a 4.75, the presentation a 4, the pricing a 4.75, and the service a 4.75.

title_review: Great But Here Is How They Can Improve
review_preview: My family and I visited Madrid during our winter vacation the day after Christmas. I had been purposely searching for a great Michelin starred restaurant to go with my parents for the holidays when I stumbled upon this gem. When we came to this restaurant...
review_full: My family and I visited Madrid during our winter vacation the day after Christmas. I had been purposely searching for a great Michelin starred restaurant to go with my parents for the holidays when I stumbled upon this gem. When we came to this restaurant at our reservation, we didn’t have the same chairs as a set like the others. It was fair I guess, since the reservation was made 12 hours before. Our waiter was extremely kind, and he tried his best to communicate with us. The food was excellent but it could be better. I had the young goat and white chocolate creamy. The goat was flavorful and tender, but I would have liked a few more diverse ingredients on the plate. The dish was a steak of goat and some pumpkin purée on the side. If I were to change it, I would have added a few vegetables or mushrooms. The whites chocolate creamy was excellent though. It was sweet and the passion fruit balanced it out perfectly. Overall Santceloni is an excellent place for special events and just has a few minor kinks. I give the food a 4.2, the environment a 4.6, the service a 4.5, and the pricing a 3.9. Overall, it’s a 4 for me.

title_review: Excellent food but slightly rushed dinner
review_preview: I selected the chef's tasting menu for dinner.  My reservation was for 9:30 on a Friday night, and I was finished by 11:15, which is incredibly fast for a Michelin 2-star dining experience.  As soon as I had finished a course, the plate was whisked...
review_full: I selected the chef's tasting menu for dinner. My reservation was for 9:30 on a Friday night, and I was finished by 11:15, which is incredibly fast for a Michelin 2-star dining experience. As soon as I had finished a course, the plate was whisked away, and the next course was "waiting in the wings." The service was competent and professional. The "coffee cream with baked chocolate mousse" was my favorite course, but all of the courses were very good. The prawn was flambeed at the table, which was a nice touch. I could see the chefs working in the kitchen from my seat, which was also a nice touch.

That lady named pammy mocked us on our way back, blaming us for an unfair demand, whereas everything was asked and planned before hand. We’d particularly recommend the roasted aubergine with Yuzu sauce- so good! The chilli was also great. And the sangria.... The atmosphere was really chilled and our waiter, Manuel, was utterly delightful. The food deserves 5 stars but if I could I’d give that again for the service.

title_review: Cozy authentic atmosphere and sensational food
review_preview: I have been looking for a cozy restaurant that had Indian gastronomy to offer. Here, not only were the prices reasonable (around 30$ per person) but each dish was simply wonderful. I personally really enjoyed the cheese naan bread and the basmati rice! The spices...
review_full: I have been looking for a cozy restaurant that had Indian gastronomy to offer. Here, not only were the prices reasonable (around 30$ per person) but each dish was simply wonderful. I personally really enjoyed the cheese naan bread and the basmati rice! The spices and textures of the currys were spot on and left me and my family with a smile on our faces. The staff were professional and were able to help us with recommendations for the dishes. The food came out fast, the cozy vibe and the authentic Indian music made everything about this dinner close to perfection. Definitely would recommend to anyone looking for a place to eat with a partner, family or friends, and would 100% go back!
